section.title: Getting platform
section.para: To download the Panifex Platform, simply follow the link: http://www.panifex.org/downloads

After the download, we should get the following files:
The downloaded files

First we need to configure access to the database, which is done by modifying conf/services/org.panifex.datasource.postgresql.properties in case of PostgreSQL. In case of Microsoft SQL Server, we need to modify conf/services/org.panifex.datasource.mssql.properties file.The key parameters to change here are:
url=jdbc:postgresql://localhost:5432/panifexdb username=postgres # The connection user name password=1234 # The connection password

The database user must have a permission to create and modify tables, because the tables have to be automatically created by http://www.liquibase.org scripts. Other parameters can be changed depending on the users preferences.

The bin folder contains scripts for running applications. Windows users will run start.bat, while Linux or MacOS users run start.sh. Now we can run the application (using start.sh or start.bat). After starting, the platform is initially run here, where it is recommended to sign in.
The login screen

The next step is to sign in, which is done using the following initial information:
Username: admin Password: admin
After this has been inserted, the application demands us to change the initial password. When the password is changed, we will see the empty content of the application we want to create or modify.
The empty content of the application
